review: I hadn't eaten at CPK in years and, since September, I've been 3 times, to 3 different locations. Each time, I'm impressed with the menu (HUGE selection) and the food - which is not phenomenal, but is good, solid an dependable. On my most recent trip - to the CambridgeSide Galleria location - I was once again disappointed with the bread. A towering stack of... plain white bread. Don't do bread if you're not going to do it right! Did I eat it? Yes, but because I was hungry! My meal, however, was a different story. When the food came, everyone at the table started commenting on how all the choices looked good. I even started to question my choice of The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped (which I knew I loved): Chopped lettuce, black beans, sweet corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, crispy corn tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese tossed together in our herb ranch dressing. Topped with chopped BBQ chicken breast, diced tomatoes and green onions. I got the dressing (MMM) on the side and of course, added the avocado (I think it was at least $2 extra?! Another salad came with the avocado. Not happy about that charge). I also got the half size, which was PERFECT. I was full, but not painfully so. My friends went with: -   Grilled Chicken Caesar Sandwich: Marinated grilled chicken breast, shredded lettuce, sliced fresh Roma tomatoes, shaved Parmesan cheese and our Caesar dressing. Served with your choice of herb onion focaccia or garlic cheese focaccia and your choice of soup, classic Caesar salad or Szechuan slaw. (One got it with a side of the Tuscan White Bean Minestrone soup: Cannellini beans, tomatoes, zucchini, spinach, onion, celery and Parmesan cheese. Served with homemade garlic-herb croutons on the side.) - Sedona Tortilla Soup: Vine-ripened tomatoes, tomatillos and corn with mild green chilies and Southwestern spices. Served with crispy corn tortilla strips on the side. Everything looked (and apparently was) great and I once again left happy. CPK is a great place for a fun meal out - with friends, family or just your honey (not for romance though).

I'll make this short and sweet: During the meal I not only spotted a mouse in the restaurant...an actual mouse ran over my FOOT. Not only was the manager not at all apologetic; he continuously blamed the malls placement of the food court and not the lack of cleanliness in his own restaurant.  I've waited tables...I know how much customers can suck. Yet it is completely outrageous to have something like a MOUSE running through the restaurant and across the extremity of a customer and not offer to at least comp their meal. I called the California Pizza Kitchen headquarters and they were appalled...offering me two free meals, still I refuse to go back. Who wants to eat in a place that not only lacks decent management, it also lacks basic cleaning skills. Beware...unless you want to contract rabies while devouring a barbequed chicken pizza.

they suck!!! ordered for a pick up and we went there to pick up our pizza and casadia, it was only 20 minutes after we placed our ordered, first of all they did not speak to us properly and made us wait for a while even they were so slow (there were only 3 tables dining), second of all the guy at the front sent us to the pick up center and then there that girl with a broken face ( angry face ) gave us our food.  the impression was very bad, when we got home and bit the slice, there was no taste, the pizza was very cold, the veggies and meat were not that well cooked.  after all we had to suck it.  I will never eat their food again.

For being someone with a college-student budget who loves fine dining so much she blows her paycheck on French restaurants, it's not easy for me to admit my love for CPK. I love this place, and it's such a guilty pleasure - I take friends here for an inexpensive meal that fills you up. I don't recommend most of the pizzas besides the Toastasa (the best, by far). The drinks are pretty decent as well.

I was in the area for a meeting and wanted to get some lunch before hand so I ended up here. I ordered the waldorf chicken salad. It took 30 minutes to come out, it doesn't take that long to make a salad! And the waitress didn't even bother to refill my water glass or update me on why the salad was taking so long. The salad was pretty good however. Unfortunately that doesn't make up for the bad service. I paid the bill and left as quickly as I could. I don't think I'll be back here anytime soon but I might just give it another try during dinner to see if it different then.

I've eaten here twice and the food has been good both times. Today our waitress was really nice and super attentive. I wish every waitress was as good as the one we had today. We had the foccaccia bread which was good and the mac and cheese bites which were ridiculously good! I could have eaten a million of those things! Then we had the spinach and artichoke pizza with chicken which was really yummy too. We were in and out in no time which I love!

If you love chain restaurants, CPK is one of the best. This place doesn't have any kind of homey, local pizza joint feel, but that's ok.  Their pizzas and pastas are tasty, and the service is spot on. The place is bright and clean, a perfect break for the afternoon at the mall.

Yes, it's a chain restaurant, so let's dispense with those formalities. However, this particular CPK is a real pleasure for one reason:  Christine the Bartender. She's a beacon of friendliness in an otherwise false-politeness-what-can-i-get-for-you-sir world of dreary chain restaurant drudgery.  Christine has the wicked awesomest accent you have ever heard, and she will totally regale you with a story. She will also shut up and let you eat.  Make no mistake, the menu here is the same as it is everywhere. The pepperoni pizza is totally worth getting, the california club is absolutely not, and everything else is kind of muddled in the middle. But if you're like me, and in the C-side Gria at 7 pm with a hungry monster inside of you, a desire for a cheap pinot noir and a willingness to watch a Red Sox game with closed-caption subtitles, well look no further than the bar at this CPK.  Tell Christine you read about her on yelp.

Everything solid and tasty as usual from CPK expect for pushy service.  Our waiter was a real pain, his name is Roman and he tried to upsell everything - "You guys sure you don't want appetizers" or "Want chicken on that salad?" or "Sure you guys don't want anything from the bar?" or "This tastes much better thin crust" etc etc UGH freakin used car salesman tried to nickel and dime us at every turn it was annoying. I like CPK but this was probably my worst visit service-wise.

Hi, my name is Katie, and I love CPK. I'm not ashamed. Really, I'm not. Cause I am a pizza girl, and all I want to do is live in a pizza world. Frozen pizza, homemade pizza...but most of all, California Pizza Kitchen pizza. I am addicted to their BBQ chicken pizza. That pizza is the stuff dreams are made of. And their Mango Tandoori Chicken pizza? Ummm, you don't mind if I moan softly and seductively while I shove it in my mouth, do you? Don't even THINK about splitting a pizza with me here. Get your own.
Food took over half-an hour to prepare and was mediocre

Ahhhh, chain restuarants. My boyfriend and his dad and I went here the other day when we ran into his dad randomly in the mall.  What does that mean?  Lunch out with dad!  Anyway, we went here because per usual, there was a line at the Cheesecake and Jesse likes pasta and pizza.  I ordered a salad, that I believe was called the asian crunch salad with chicken, which I got with avocado.  I have a total addiction to avocado and I will admit I have a problem.  Jesse got a pasta dish, and John got a ceasar salad, and we were all content with our dishes.  My salad was a wild combination of chicken, cilantro, cabbage (red and green), peanuts, avocado, and all sorts of crunchy things....it was good and very filling for a half order.  I would suggest sticking with half orders here unless you want leftovers for the next day. I would go here again if I was in the area, but it's definitely not something to go out of your way for.....I would try the pizza since it has such mixed reviews.
Decent pizza, I really enjoy the Peking duck pizza. Had an appetizer there once also, which was good. If your in the mall, and have time, why not try one out. But don't go out of your way for it.

god I love their pizza! I used to be able to get the mushroom pizza at the grocery store and it was sooo good, but now I gottah come here to get it. I never try anything new because I love it so much. My husband on the other hand tries new things often, and tends to love them all. I will say that he has been raving about their jambalaya for years, and whenever he gets it from another restaurant he always says that CPK is the best he's ever had! oooh and good prices, clean, nice staff etc... two thumbs up!

The pizza was good as expected with CPK tradition. I had the Hawaiian so delish. Apps were solid. We had a bread stick sampler, dumpling and a hummus and pita dish. It certainly hit the spot. The hostess and waitress were very helpful, pleasant and friendly. They made the experience that much more enjoyable.

Dear California Pizza Kitchen, I love you, really, I do. I love that I can get an entire pizza to myself on honey wheat - and have delicious leftovers for later. I love your pizza with the fresh avocado slices and a spicy chipotle sauce. But I'm sorry, but I made better avocado egg rolls than you.. this relationship is clearly going nowhere. But I just can't help but grasp my hands onto your honey dough as soon as I spot your neon sign. ps.. you're so much better than the cheesecake factory. don't let anyone tell you different!

An excellent chain, with typically good service and good vegan/vegetarian options.  Vegans: try the Dakota Smashed Pea & Barley Soup and the Field Greens Salad (w/o cheese, of course). I hear they have other options, but I've gotten so hooked on these two that I've never ordered anything else.   My non-vegetarian friends love this place for its fresh pasta and pizza options.  Almost always over-air conditioned, though, so bring a sweater.

The food is tasty, but the service at this location isn't great. It's slow, the servers are inattentive, and I've been known to have orders screwed up. It's also expensive for what it is. That being said, the salads are great. They have some very interesting pizzas that I would probably never order but ended up tasting great in spite of having kinda scary-sounding descriptions. If you're in the area and looking for something other than sandwiches, CPK is one of your few choices - but be prepared for slow service and overpriced but tasty food.

One of my favourite places to go to when I'm with friends. I've only been to this one once, though. My friend and I were put in a corner but we weren't neglected.  I didn't like the miso salad. It didn't taste like anything. The name sounds Asian enough, but I wasn't impressed. The Jambalaya was different, though. It was spicy enough for me and the shrimp was juicy. My other complaint, though, is the fact that their tables are too small. Their dishes are huge.

First of all I swear I don't only eat in chain eateries.  Lately my friends have been dragging me to these places though.  I went on Saturday with a friend and the whole dining experience was mediocre at best.  The food was okay.  Nothing really excited my tastebuds.  The service would have got a higher rating but I didn't get utensils or plates for appetizers so they get a mediocre on that.  They were quick to correct the problem though.  I have a degree in culinary arts so my expectations are pretty high.  I should know better than going to places like CPK but I have scape goats... I mean friends :)

So none of us went into this restaurant with great expectations since we've been before ages ago and didn't remember if it was any good.  Of the four pizzas we tried, there was only one half-satisfied customer at our table (with the Thai chicken). Definitely stay away from the salad pizzas. The jerk chicken was dry and the pieces were tiny.  I guess stay away from any of the ones that seem like they should be their own dish and not on a pizza. Even the standard white cheese, garlic and spinach pizza wasn't that great.  The only thing that all of us liked was the artichoke-spinach dip, but there wasn't even enough to go on half the chips.  Gave it one star because of the yummy dip- it was also a shorter wait than the Cheesecake Factory and didn't make us resort to the food court. Though now that I think about it, I would have rather spent the money at the food court and gotten dessert and a couple drinks at the Cheesecake Factory.

CPK is another pizza chain restaurant. But it unlike any of it's competitors. I'm surprised I'm actually a fan because I generally dislike chain restaurants. I've only been here once so I haven't ate here enough to get a better jist of the place. I had ate the frozen pizza before and wanted to try the restaurant.  CPK has really interesting, different combos of pizza. Ones like cheeseburger, meat cravers, california club, carne asada, pear & gorgonzola, chipotle, and many more. I ordered two personal pizzas for us to share and we still took leftovers to go. The pizza is not on my top list of pizzas but it was definitely tasty. What I love about it, is the thin lightness of the pizza. It was perfectly thin and full of toppings. I hate thick pizza. I ordered a shrimp pizza that they do not carry anymore and the roasted garlic chicken. Both tasted really good. A lot of people ordered salads and they were large in size.  The restaurant was very packed and full of teenagers. Still when we arrived we got a table right away and didn't have to wait. The service was good for being so busy. You don't need a lot of help when just ordering a pizza. Though I'm sure I would get sick of this place if there was one closer by.

Tastier pizzas can be found at Pizza Hut and the bill will be a quarter of what you pay here. Service and pizza delivery was slow, which is kind of expected since they're cooked to order, so I can't fault them for that. But worth the stop? No. Next time we'll go across the hall to the Cheesecake Factory where prices are about the same but the food and portion sizes are much better.

As far as chains go, this one is solid because the portions are not overwhelming and they give you the guise of healthy with their whole wheat crust. The pizza toppings are more inventive than at Bertucci's, so if you want pizza with a flair, go here.

I've eaten here once, and I LOVE CPK, but my last attempted visit sucked.  I was at the mall and it was starting to get late so I thought I'd grab some CPK to go.  I get to the restaurant around 8:55 and on the restaurant door they close at 10pm on M-Th.  I wanted to order takeout, but they told me they were already closing the kitchen.  Uhmmm WTF?  They're closing an hour early?  Hello lazy workers MAKE ME SOME PIZZA!!!  I was really pissed off and vented at the manager and he gave me a $5 gift certificate as if it would have made up for me not getting pizza, to be honest, I would have paid double if they just made it for me.  When I'm hungry and I want what I want, the cost ends up almost not mattering to me.

I went for the first time this fall to one of these restaurants and it was great. We sat outside at the Galleria location and enjoyed our meal. I always buy the frozen pizza's (BBQ chicken my fave) in the supermarket but when I dined in I was impressed. I had a delicious pasta dish the server recommended that was very fresh and tasty. The food was very reasonably priced too. Definately will go again.

Bleh.  Overpriced.  Lacks freshness.  Over-oiled.  [Just got distracted by a shot of tequila.  On TV]  Small portions.  Sure, there's outdoor seating, but that's all I think CPK has going for them.  Sorry pizza-lovers.  CPK is not my idea of good pizza, or pasta, or salad.  Bleh.

At this point I have to say that I'm addicted to their Thai Crunch Salad. You'd be hard pressed to fit it into the 'healthy' category as it comes with crispy wonton strips and two dressings, one of them a delicious (and highly addictive) thai peanut dressing. But its damn good, the veggies are super fresh, and you can place your order online and drive by to pick it up in 15 minutes. Warning - the full size is pretty big and enough for two people - probably why they also come in half size too.
just get three things- the thai crunch salad, bolognese spaghetti and sicilian pizza = yummy meal!

Been here a lot since its close to where I live. The waiter always forget my order of chicken with my pasta. We gone there at least 10 times and out of the 10 times they always forget it. They charged like $4.50 to add chicken with their pasta. Not sure why they would always forget. The manager always apologies but its always the same ordeal. I try not to go to this location if could. The one the prudential building is consistently better then the other locations.

I've been to all three boston locations, so i'll just write one for all.  They all seem pretty similar (it is a chain after all) with no difference in service.  though it's a chain, i like it here. they have such a yummy range of different pizzas, which are not all soggy like house of pizza place pizzas are.  i love specialty pizza.  i usually get the vegetarian ones, not cuz i am one, just becuase they taste good. and they have whole wheat honey crust as an option which is good.  get the whole pizza and take the rest home as a snack.

I went to this place a couple of weeks ago with my family to celebrate a birthday. The food in this place is priced reasonably and tastes rather good. However, the pizza is generic in my opinion. It does not project a unique taste. I recommend the Greek Pizza here; it's really tasty. Do not buy the appetizers here, they are overpriced and don't taste that good either. I think this place is decent, but in no way excellent.

It is overpriced, but c'mon, it's at the galleria -- what did you expect? They are good about getting you in and out quickly when you need it (which is excellent at lunch when you have a meeting at 1:00). And they have some really cool pizzas -- my favorite is the BLT. I certainly wouldn't pick it for a last meal, but once in a while it's good stuff.

Mmmmm, bad food.  This huge chain has gone way down hill over the years.  They are super overpriced, and though they come up with fancy names for everything, and make them sound great on the menu, you'll be sure to get something that doesn't look or taste anywhere as good as you had hoped.
Not bad, but kinda overpriced. I also think they put sugar (and too much of it) in their dough...weird.  I like the steak and Monterey jack pizza, it's good.  That's about it though...

I am not a big fan of shopping malls but I am a fan of eating and I ended up at this CPK on a Sunday afternoon. The mall was packed but the restaurant was quiet.  We got the spinach and artichoke dip and while it was good I remember it being better years ago.  Also, some of the chips seemed stale and I always feel like they give you way too many chips since you finish the dip and still have 1/2 the chips left on the plate. Anyway, I got a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and was asked if I wanted 6 or 9 ounces.  I only got 6 ounces because 9 ounces sounded like a lot.  And it was the afternoon and I knew I'd be drinking later in the day with dinner. I ended up getting the field green salad with candied walnuts, pears and a dijon vinaigrette.  The salad was good and big and I only got a 1/2 salad.  The full salad I was told was huge and I really don't feel like a Big Salad of Epic Proportions like the kind you get across the way at Cheesecake Factory. Our server was very nice and friendly and fast, her name was Anna. I always appreciate good service and we will be back very soon. The old ball and chain got the kung pao pasta and enjoyed it.  I thought it looked good but was trying to be healthy and that's why I got a salad. The price was forty something bucks and I think that's a good deal. We will definitely be back soon when the craving for CPK comes upon us! *Note, they validate for parking and it was only $1.99 to park in the garage in the mall.  Another great deal!

I'm beyond HORRIFIED. First of all, the service was very poor and ridiculously slow. We sat down, asked for water, but the water came out in about 30minutes. No one came to our table and we had to ask two other waiter/waitress until we got our waiter.  We ordered three entrees. First one (Jambalaya fettuccine) had a piece of plastic in it. Again, it took forever to get our waiter and then to get the manager. The manager said he'll take it off our bill and said he doesn't know why it's in there. He asked us if we wanted another one or what we wanted him to do. He wasn't very apologetic. If anything he came off as rude making us feel like we were the ones overreacting.  Then  came my salad. I ate 1/3 way through the salad, when I found a receipt. It was a whole receipt at the bottom of my salad. I was so shocked that I was having palpitation and my hand started shaking. What was even more disgusting was the fact that the receipt wasnt even for our order. We had to call the manager again. He was more apologetic than the first time and again took it off our bill.  What was even more ridiculous was the fact that the manager had brought back the salad with the receipt in it and left it on our table. Like why would you even give it back to us. Did they actually expect us to eat?? When our third entree came we just didn't have any appetite and just asked them to take it back.

Not a good time.  This place was highly recommended by a co-worker who swore by it.  I took my daughter there for lunch a couple of weeks ago and was not impressed.  The meal started off on sour note when I was given a dirty cup for my tepid green tea.  The next downer was the appetizers - frozen sesame ginger chicken dumplings.  I could have just went to BJ's and purchased the bag myself.  Pizza was okay - thin crust artichoke, spinach and chicken.  Chicken slices were skimpy.  The house salad was mainly lettuce.  Our waiter was very disinterested keeping tabs on us but, because its a crappy job I still left a tip.  My tip for CPK in the Galleria mall is to take more care with your dishwashing and food preparation.  First and last trip. I totally understand why this establishment is no longer open.

Had such a build up after hearing & see friends pics for months about CPK, but it was just Ok...  Went for lunch with some friends from work & it was cool but wasnt the best thing ever. I think it was a little over-priced for just pizza!
The food was ok, not my favorite. I would be back again if in the mall, better than food court food. The service was a little on the slow side, but friendly.

Pro: Gluten free options Con: They serve cheese on your cheese pizzas sparingly CPK is not too far, and it's a good place for me to get a quick lunch on a weekend. However, I've run into several problems: (1) The portion options for the GF contingent (me) are just not fair. Why do I have to consume so much of a pizza when my non-Celiac friends can eat less and pay less? I don't know how other people do it, but pizza leftovers are just gross...especially when they're gluten free. Remember, people, this is not NYC, the pizza is pretty bad.  If you absolutely have to, get the Untraditional cheese. It's still pretty bad, but you will at least not have to deal with the incredibly stale 35-day old crust that they try to serve you as if it's fresh. Be not fooled, my GF buddies, this grossness can not be fresh at all.  Online ordering is easy. Pickup is easy.  But..the guacamole is also gross. Am I being very judgmental today? I think so, but I wouldn't be this way if I didn't have a reason. I've been here about 4 times, total, and I haven't had any experience that deserves more than 2 stars (and I've had some that deserve less...I think you would agree if you ended up with ingredients on your pizza that you never asked for)!  Want gluten free pizza? I'm going to keep looking. I've found some locally, but I don't recommend this to you unless you're absolutely desperate.

The majority of the experience was "meh". I was seated at a four person table, which could be why the waitress was not the friendliest. Don't get me wrong, she did her job and in a timely manner but she wasn't as friendly and welcoming as waitresses often are and things felt rushed. I ordered the garlic cream fettuccine with chicken added. It looked creamy when it first arrived but soon became very dry, almost glue-like as it cooled down. The flavor also wasn't all the way there; kind of bland. The chicken was cooked fine, not too dry or anything. I will say, their desserts are great. The Tiramisu was excellent. It was the bright spot in my dining experience.

My boyfriend and I LOVE this CPK! I really can't say enough good things. For a chain restaurant we are so impressed. Such friendly staff and delicious food. We eat here very, very often. Most of the time we dine in, sometimes we do take-out. My favorite is the Chinese Chicken Salad...awesome. My boyfriend likes to change it up (he's not picky like me!), but one of his favorites is the Waldorf Salad. We will always go back to this CPK!

So, the food is always tasty... I'm a sucker for the Chinese chicken salad (half portion will feed two comfortably), and the carnitas pizza with that habanero salsa (caution: uber tasty and SPICY!)... that's not my gripe with this place. In fact, I was all set to give it a more favorable rating, but the last time I came here, I was lied to. And I didn't need to be.  I had ordered the pizza with whole wheat crust, and after taking my first few bites, I knew without a doubt that it was on white crust. My dinner partner had already scarfed down a few slices while I was still on my first few bites, and I just casually said, "This isn't whole wheat." A few chews later, said partner agreed, so I flagged down our waitress and just asked her, "Is this whole wheat?" To which she replied, "Yes -- we've switched to a new wheat crust which is fluffier."  ... Did you switch to a wheat crust that's also white? Girl, you could've just said, oh, my bad, my mistake, and that would've been fine. I mean, the pizza was already almost all gone, so it's not like I would've sent it back, but I just wanted to confirm what I already knew. Out of principle. Because I knew I had ordered it specifically on wheat. Sigh. Just left a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively. Oh, well. You can't win 'em all...

Service was okay. Food was okay. Ambiance was okay. Drinks were okay. I guess A-OK is what it deserves. We had -Korean beef tacos: okay, but the pita tasted a little funny (like soap) -Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza: okay, but too sweet -Passion Fruit Mojitos: great. In comparison to the Cheesecake Factory next to it, I'd say I prefer the Cheesecake Factory, but CPK is much brighter, and feels happier for a quick lunch between shopping.

Very nice experience eating here.  While this place does not feel high-end, it doesn't need too.  They serve very good food at a reasonable price.  I tried a flatbread pizza and a chicken sandwich and both were very much at my expectations.  The food came out fresh and hot.  I particularly appreciated the open kitchen, but found the dining room itself to feel a little "sticky" as in the tables are not well wiped and there is little attention to detail.  But, with a staff that seems to just be learning the restaurant industry, it is probably something to be expected.  The manager was very nice and friendly, and he seemed to really set the tone for the staff because they are all very nice as well. One thing I appreciated was the teamwork I experienced.  Servers other than our own did not hesitate to step in and refill my water glass.  That kind of attention goes a long way and I very much appreciated it.

Great food, I was suprised at the selection, lots of good things to eat, service was good, although my server could do a little more interacting with guest, not very personal, but efficient. The two drinks I had the blood orange sangria was perfect the Moscow Mule, also very good. I had the Jambalaya, very spicy but that's ok it was great.

Went her after a show Saturday night and there was no wait so we were seated quickly. Our waitress came over and we ordered drinks. She came back with our drinks and asked if we wanted any appetizers which we did. We ordered the Spinach and Artichoke dip as well as the White Corn Guacamole. I thought the Spinach and Artichoke dip was too garlicky and a little bitter. The guacamole was tasty but was too small given the large amount of chips they gave us. No big deal.  The entrees were also just ok. One friend got the pulled pork pizza and the other got the margarita pizza. Both were fine, could have been crispier. I got the shrimp scampi which lacked flavor. I gave this place another shot and fell short again.

Went in today and got a BBQ Chicken pizza, probably their most popular pizza they have going.  Usually I go to the California Pizza at the Natick mall and I will tell you that the price is cheaper there!  The reason why is at the Natick Mall the pizza comes with the Pineapple slices but at Cambridge Mall it doesnt so you have to pay extra to add it on.....   The pizza is already small enough and expensive enough (little over 13 dollars) without having to pay two dollars more for some pineapple.  Don't get me wrong the quality is good food but you could pick up 3 dominos small pizzas ( same size as california's Only size pizza they serve) for the same price for one BBQ Chicken at CP.

Meh, Its really just like every other  chain pizza restaurant I've ever step my foot into. The only reason why I was in there in the first place is because I ordered a pizza there because it was the nearest pizza restaurant near the hotel I was staying. What can I say? it has much more to be desired.

Here's a story of a CPK visit... We arrived, no wait, and many open tables - lunchtime... ok good!  We where seated at the table next to the door... not good. I asked to sit next the the table behind the doorway, just a little more private. Sure! they moved us.  This is where it went sour- apparently you aren't allowed to get service at the table we where at b/c someone else sat at the table we where originally offered and got drinks right away, their order taken and delivered timely and that manager came by the thank them for eating there.  We got - no service, had to ask for a waiter, water but no refills, our order taken but about 30 minutes AFTER we sat. Not good at all. Also - we wanted to pay... fat chance about that - we asked for the check, the waitress said sure and walked by 4 times and didn't bring it. Dude, it's lunchtime - in and out fast! I've worked lunch before at high turnover restaurants, this was no good. I had to find the manager and ask for our bill.  he did apologize a little and took 20% off the bill but i'm still not going back. I'm writing a review to tell you all not to go and i'm telling everyone in my office not to go as well.  Sucks for you CPK. Food was fine but who case after that service experience.

Attentive servers, prompt seating and good food on a Sat afternoon.  Really liked the kiwi soda, moroccan salad, kung pao spaghetti, and chipotle chicken pizza. Oh and the bread was pretty good too (not hard at all).

Wow.  All around horrible.  And this isn't one of those "I"m going to write a 1 star review to voice my opinion because I want attention" rants.  This was like "huge disappointment, never going back there" rant. I never have the highest expectations for chain restaurants, but going to plenty of CPKs I enjoy the experience anyways, well usually.  Walked into the restaurant, server puts us in a table.  It takes us about 10 minutes to order, even tho we already knew what we were going to get coming in. We didn't get a waiter assigned to us, even tho the restaurant is empty.  We wave down the host, he looks at us, and then continues chatting with a waitress. haha that was just weird.  Takes us a while but we finally get water and bread, that is after asking for both on separate occassions. The food: ordered two standard items - the Sicilian pizza and the Chicken Tequila Fettucini.  Both were pretty bad in their own way.  This is the description of the Sicilian: "sweet Italian sausage, spicy Capicola ham, julienne salami, Fontina, Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses"  Check out the pic that I uploaded, looks more like cheese and sausage to me haha and no ham or salami.  On TOP of that, it was burned to a black crisp.  You can tell from the photo, but I wish in hindsight that I had taken a picture of the pile of burned stuff we pulled off from the pizza. For the chicken tequila, i already had my critical eye on, but i realized that there was not much of the chicken that i could find.  Being the nosy reviewer that I am, I proceeded to take every little bit of chicken and put it on the side, ending up with ...half a chicken breast? one third?  lame.  at least it still tasted like normal cpk dish.  I uploaded that pic too :)   Sigh, well I can't wait to hit up some good CPK food, just not at this location.  Seriously, this store needs to get their act together.  In fact, why even go here when there is that cheesecake factory right next door?  In fact that's what we did, after our CPK we got a nice slice of cheesecake for home :)

Eh, it's a mall chain restaurant.  Today was their last day of  being open, so I was a little hesitant about ordering.  $5.99 for a bottle of Guinness seemed a bit high.  Processed food.  Basically what you'd expect.  But, guess we won't be going back!

I gotta give this CPK location some mad props.  [throws hands in air like i just don't care]  For a chain, they are doing it right.  I've been there four times now, and every single visit has been stellar. And here are the reasons why: #1.  Outdoor seating. #2.  Great tasting pizza. #3.  Value.  Reasonable prices & generous portions. #4.  (and most important) EXCELLENT service. I can't stress how great the service has been on all four of my visits.  The servers are friendly, professional, attentive, etc etc etc. My only suggestion for this place would be to extend the beer menu. Good job, CPK.

Me and my family went out Saturday for dinner. Service was good in the beginning but then our waitress forgot all about us, we had to go find her somewhere, I guess she wanted to leave so she focused on her cleaning while we sat there waiting to get our bill, which was also incorrect!!!!!! Not only that but my husband began to feel nauseas and we had to go to the hospital after that. So the doctor diagnosed that he was basically food poisoned and that he had a bacteria from something he ate that was contaminated!!!!!!! We do not recommend this place and will never come back what a horrible experience.

This place is really good.  They have an awesome menu with just about everything you can imagine on it.  It is very well priced.  They also have a really awesome beer list including local beers.  My wife and I went here recently and we are already looking forward to going back!

Honestly it was just okay. I went here with my boyfriend and his mother yesterday for a fundraiser for the Cambridge After School Program. In all honesty I didn't choose to come here they did. It never seemed appealing to me so I had never walked in until yesterday. We walked in and were seated instantly by a very nice waitress. I ended up ordering a Garlic Parmesan fettuccine. It only took 15 minutes to get our food. Once our food had arrived the waitress informed me that I got the wrong order and that my order would be coming out shortly. Honestly what I almost got looked more appealing than what I actually got. It was very bland and I had to force myself to finish the rest. The portions were reasonable and I didn't need to carry out. But over all not to special. Won't go out of my way to go here and would much prefer Cheesecake Factory.

I don't often go here.. but I went for lunch recently with a friend; I must admit, I LOVE their chipotle chicken pizza and baby clam linguini! UGH, I'd definitely go back so lunch whenever I get the chance! :)

Food and price point are good, but if you order online don't ever expect things to be on time. I have ordered online several times (when I don't have time to spare), and the food is NEVER ready on time. The staff is not apologetic about it at all. There are other options in the area that are ready when they say they will be. Go to them instead.

I love this place! I actually look forward to visiting this mall for work, so I can enjoy lunch at CPK. I have loved everything I have tried but almost always order the carnitas tacos with avocado or the cobb salad. They get you seated and fed in a friendly and efficient manner so you don't feel rushed even though you are there at lunch.

This location does a nice job for this chain.  It's clean every time I go, and the staff is typically friendly and attentive.  Never had a bad pizza and most of the apps are pretty good.  I really enjoy the buffalo chicken salad here, perfect to go at lunch time.   At dinner highlight is they invited the kids to go into the kitchen and help cook their own pizzas which they enjoyed very much.   Obviously one of the best options to eat at the Galleria.

I am always a fan of CPK but the service here really sucks, took a order really quick never got the drinks whatever we ordered. Never bothered to ask about the food. And guess what folks restaurant was very slowly be it was Monday lunch and all the ppl was doing shopping during Veterans Day sale. I don't think so I will be back in this location.

The salads are made primarily using the whitest iceberg lettuce you have ever seen. To cause further injury, it was browning and unappetizing. It was a large group and several pasta dishes were tried and not one person was impressed, everyone had overcooked pasta. Perhaps with pizza in the name we should have just stuck to pizza. This was placed on the list of never again.

First of all, our server was adorable. I wish I could remember her name because she really was wonderful. Onto the food... I ordered a roasted veggie sandwich with a cup of split pea and barley soup - based off Lauren L's review :) - and while I have to say I enjoyed my meal, checking out the nutrition facts later on was a little disheartening. 1,200 calories for a cup of soup and a smallish vegetable sandwich? It's probably my own fault for not checking this out beforehand but it upsets me when chains like CPK and Cheesecake Factory manage to pull out huge numbers of calories for what seem like slightly healthy meals.  Anyway, everyone in my family enjoyed their meals and I would definitely go back for another cup of that soup. Plus, they have a pretty creative marketing scheme going on where they give you cards that contain a prize (every card has something - ranging from discounts to trips to Hawaii), but only a manager from CPK can open it on your next visit. Next time I'll be better prepared and maybe even come back with some cash :)

I don't eat at chains when it's my turn to pick where we're eating. I like to know that my money stays local and I'm getting a unique dish.  I moaned endlessly about having to go to CPK. I'm a vegan which vastly limits my choices at a pizza joint. That being said, I had a salad with cannelini beans and avocado with a light vinagrette. It was pretty good, but nothing to sing about. What I was impressed with was our server. We came in with a group of  6 ladies, each of whom had approximately 25 questions. Kevin, our fabulous waiter, knew the answers to most of them, and when he didn't, he answered honestly and asked the kitchen. I hate when servers guess and then I have an allergic reaction to your food. Honesty is greatly appreciated.  The service was friendly and we didn't have to wait for anything.  Thanks Kevin!

Good food as always, but waitstaff not to good. My friend finished his meal and I was still eating when the waitstaff ask for dessert and my friend said no. The waiter started to clear the table, brought the check over and put my friends take home on the table. I was still eating I think they should be trained better, I will not come to this one in Cambridge again, I was pushed out so fast and couldn't enjoy eating my meal with those two things staring at me.

I put off reviewing CPK because I'm a ashamed of how much I like the food here.  Me? The adventurous, street cart food lover, the explorer of sticky-tabled Chinatown joints with Cold War era lighting, connoisseur of Indian restaurants known to give my Indian-friends-from-Inda the infamous 'Bombay Belly'  REALLY LIKING this mall chain's food? Unimaginable. Blasphemous, even.  But the truth must come out. I love their split pea and barley soup. It's in my top 5 soups of all time (up there with a fancy shmancy L'espalier cream soup that came with a mini savory custard). The soup is amazing. My friend who does not ingest greens or vegetables eagerly orders this soup and consumes it, green split peas and all.  My favorite salad in the world is also made here. The Moroccan salad with grilled chicken, dried dates, butternut squash, avocado, beets and champagne vinaigrette is so damn delicious, I crave it all the time and look for excuses to come to CPK for it. I need to buy some clothes? Perfect, I can go to Cambridgeside and eat The Salad. Need shoes? Cambrideside it is...followed by The Salad. Run out of shower gel? The CVS close by isn't good enough, I have to go to Cambrideside's and grab The Salad on my way out.  It's that good.   Service is hit or miss. Prices are reasonable. Sometimes there are noisy, boisterous patrons. Their drink selection isn't great. But for chain restaurants, it's not bad. The Salad and The Soup just put it over the top for me. I'll admit it, I lo--.....like CPK. A lot.

Made such a great dinner place! CPK is awesome! Service: We quickly got seated when we came in on a Friday night! It was very nice and clean! Our server came over and got our drink orders and app and pizza order. The server was very friendly to our needs and took good care of us. Anytime a drink was low he would come by and give us a new one! He also came back to make sure the app and pizza came out the way we would have liked it too. The service was great! Food: Our app was the Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings. They came out perfect and hot just the way we like it! The dipping sauce was very good as well. I could commend this to anyone! We also got a Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza. This over all was pretty good. The only thing about this I didn't like is it tasted like they used to much of the jerk spice. I know for some of you out there its how you like it. A little less could have made it just perfect! Now I cant knock it because when we got eating it only got better. It was just that first bite. After that it was very yummy! If you like a kick with your pizza that's not buffalo then this one is for you! Also on the plus side here the crust from this place is amazing! Not so sure it can be beat yet! Price: The app was around $7.00 and the pizza was around $13.00. So with drinks running about $5.00 for 2 it was pretty cheap for 2 to eat. There for the price was right on where I think it should be! plus we went home with left overs! Over all: I am for sure going back soon! They have service thats hard to beat and the food is just plain good! I gave it a 4 outta 5 stars becuase the pizza was good just to much jerk spice IMO. So to be fair when I go back I will re-visit it. More than likely will be a 5/5 by then. Dont shy away from this place. Its amazing! Go eat! Very very strong 4/5 (More like a 4 and half outta 5)...Go get your pizza on!

It's a chain. There I said it. Typically I stay as far away from chains as possible and try to seek out more unique places to eat, but in the case of CPK I'm willing to make an exception once in a while.  The service is hit or miss. Sometimes you have to ask for bread. Sometimes they forget to put your dressing on the side. But ... the pizza at CPK is good. My favorite is the 5 cheese and tomato. But most of the time I opt for a salad. They offer some great salad options like the grilled vegetable salad or the thai crunch salad. The lunch portions are perfect and they are reasonably priced.  In my book, CPK gets a solid 3 star A-OK rating.
Ugh there pizza tasted good but over priced :/ like what twelve dollars for a pizza the size of a plate.

Altough I try to avoid chain restaurants as often as possible, I do once in a while enjoy hitting up CPK, especially since it's very close to my house and conveniently located inside the Cambridgeside Galleria mall. The place itself is clean and run very efficiently. Their menu is reliable and I love their California Club pizza along with their lettuce wraps. That what I pretty much always get there. The prices are decent but as far as the culinary experience goes, the food from a critical standpoint is mediocre. It's obviously not something that's very custom made or researched. It's very.. linear. But it works.  The service is usually very good and you get free refills on most drinks. Their cocktails are also very good and they have mojitos which is a rare thing in Boston. Nothing outstanding but decent and reliable enough to make it worth it once in a while. And great for groups.

Delicious things I've had here: Tiramisu Butter cake Apple crisp veggie sandwich (without the cheese) tortilla soup fish tacos salmon entree Not so delicious things: Chicken milanese (entree) steak tacos the sides to their entrees (wok-stirred veggies, spaghetti, etc.) their pizza (crust too oily) Overall, I'm a fan because of their consistency and because, clearly, I've enjoyed more of their meals than not.

Went to dinner with a legally blind friend here and upon entering the restaurant we asked if they had a braille menu. The waitress spoke little to no English and could not understand what I was asking for. I said it again, "do you have a braille menu? For blind people?" She handed me the wine list. After several attempts of explaining and hand gestures she finally got what we were asking for and they had one.  We were seated and the waitress came right over but I was a little disappointed that her English also was not very good. Last time I checked we were in Cambridge, MA - I don't think I'm asking a lot to be able to communicate with my server at a restaurant. Maybe I'm wrong.  The food came out quickly and was fine. I wouldn't go back to this location however simply because of the language barrier.
I really enjoyed the seasonal sprouts, goats cheese and bacon pizza I had today. No nonsense, efficient service, good range of beer, no complaints.
